page.title: 14PEELWELL, HAYDON BRIDGE.
page.content: This former farmhouse is a{rest home for Senior Citizens. It is owned by Mr.& Mrs.Moore, the latter being a State Registered Nurse. The Home has 15 guests. Three are over{90}& include Miss Shortridge. She formerly taught Maths. at Queen Elizabeth Grammar School, Hexham.The{farm}buildings are being removed or restored after a fire six years ago. Much of the stone has been sold to build walls & houses. The name of the house indicates that a {pele tower}once stood there. During {Border raids}the livestock were put on the ground floor and people on the higher storeys; doors were barred. A sculpted, low-relief{Roman}stone, mud weathered, was taken in 1973 to Vindolanda from a Peelwell barn, suggesting that Peelwell was built in part from stone taken from{Hadrian's {Wall.
